title: 'It's going to be a massive game': New Zealand's 2011 World Cup final hero Stephen Donald relishing England clash
text:
Stephen Donald has lived every New Zealand child’s dream. He kicked what proved to be the winning penalty, in a World Cup final, at Eden Park, to end 24 years of pain for the All Blacks. Boys’ Own stuff.

So if anyone’s version of events might be coloured by bias, it would be his. “When you talk about having the time of your life, that’s something I’ll never forget,” admits the man who famously missed his 11th-hour summons from coach Graham Henry because he was out fishing for whitebait. “From a rugby point of view, they are hands down the happiest times of my life.”

Even Donald, though, would not try to claim that 2011 finale was in any way pretty. New Zealand were “massively under the pump”...
description: Stephen Donald has lived every New Zealand child’s dream.
